byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and QUENTIN HARDY

abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Carly Fiorina has gone to great lengths in her campaign to redefine her rocky business career as successful; effort has run up against announcement by her former company Hewlett-Packard that it will slash jobs and split up into two companies, which many view as repudiation of her record.
lead_paragraph: The presidential hopeful has prepared to counter accusations that she mismanaged Hewlett-Packard and callously laid off workers — the kind of criticism that hurt her in a 2010 Senate race.

headline.main: As Profile Rises, Carly Fiorina Aims to Redefine Record as a C.E.O.
headline.print_headline: As Profile Rises, Fiorina Aims to Redefine Record as a C.E.O.

snippet: The presidential hopeful has prepared to counter accusations that she mismanaged Hewlett-Packard and callously laid off workers — the kind of criticism that hurt her in a 2010 Senate race.
